Bait and switch\, aggravated

As already said by many\, Disney lured people into the theaters by using trailers made with the evident purpose of letting them think they were about to watch a REAL Star Wars movie. There were no hints of the director's intention to completely destroy the franchise in order to clean up the canvas for the new "version" of it.
It has correctly been described as a form of Bait and Switch\, an illegal conduct by which someone lures you into buying something with certain desirable and worthy features and\, after you have paid for it\, they give you something less worthy.

They did it again with the trailer for the BluRay/DVD edition of The Last Jedi.

Watch the trailer\, and you will find NONE of the most hated features and scenes of it. No trace of Canto Bight. NO TRACE OF ROSE TICO !!!! No trace of all-males-are-evil and all-female-are-good propaganda. No trace of the purple haired inept vice admiral Holdo.
The movie they present in the trailer IS NOT the movie you will get in the BluRay/DVD edition.
